id.description:
A unique Square-assigned ID for the customer profile.

If you need this ID for an API request, use the ID returned when you created the customer profile or call the [SearchCustomers](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2022-03-16/customers-api/search-customers) 
or [ListCustomers](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2022-03-16/customers-api/list-customers) endpoint.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the customer profile was created, in RFC 3339 format.

updated_at.description: The timestamp when the customer profile was last updated, in RFC 3339 format.

id.description: Unique ID for this card. Generated by Square.

last_4.description: The last 4 digits of the card number.

exp_month.description: The expiration month of the associated card as an integer between 1 and 12.

exp_year.description: The four-digit year of the card's expiration date.

billing_address.description: The billing address for this card.

address_line_1.description:
The first line of the address.

Fields that start with `address_line` provide the address's most specific
details, like street number, street name, and building name. They do *not*
provide less specific details like city, state/province, or country (these
details are provided in other fields).

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, if any.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if any.

locality.description: The city or town of the address. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

sublocality.description: A civil region within the address's `locality`, if any.

administrative_district_level_1.description:
A civil entity within the address's country. In the US, this
is the state. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

postal_code.description: The address's postal code. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

country.description: The address's country, in the two-letter format of ISO 3166. For example, `US` or `FR`.

fingerprint.description:
Intended as a Square-assigned identifier, based
on the card number, to identify the card across multiple locations within a
single application.

customer_id.description: **Required** The ID of a customer created using the Customers API to be associated with the card.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the merchant associated with the card.

reference_id.description:
An optional user-defined reference ID that associates this card with
another entity in an external system. For example, a customer ID from an
external customer management system.

enabled.description: Indicates whether or not a card can be used for payments.

card_type.description:
The type of the card.
The Card object includes this field only in response to Payments API calls.

prepaid_type.description:
Indicates whether the Card is prepaid or not.
The Card object includes this field only in response to Payments API calls.

bin.description:
The first six digits of the card number, known as the Bank Identification Number (BIN). Only the Payments API
returns this field.

version.description:
Current version number of the card. Increments with each card update. Requests to update an
existing Card object will be rejected unless the version in the request matches the current
version for the Card.

items.description:
Represents the payment details of a card to be used for payments. These
details are determined by the payment token generated by Web Payments SDK.

cards.description:
Payment details of the credit, debit, and gift cards stored on file for the customer profile. 

DEPRECATED at version 2021-06-16. Replaced by calling [ListCards](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2022-03-16/cards-api/list-cards) (for credit and debit cards on file) 
or [ListGiftCards](https://developer.squareup.com/reference/square_2022-03-16/gift-cards-api/list-gift-cards) (for gift cards on file) and including the `customer_id` query parameter. 
For more information, see [Migration notes](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/what-it-does#migrate-customer-cards).

given_name.description: The given name (that is, the first name) associated with the customer profile.

family_name.description: The family name (that is, the last name) associated with the customer profile.

nickname.description: A nickname for the customer profile.

company_name.description: A business name associated with the customer profile.

email_address.description: The email address associated with the customer profile.

address.description: The physical address associated with the customer profile.

address_line_1.description:
The first line of the address.

Fields that start with `address_line` provide the address's most specific
details, like street number, street name, and building name. They do *not*
provide less specific details like city, state/province, or country (these
details are provided in other fields).

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, if any.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if any.

locality.description: The city or town of the address. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

sublocality.description: A civil region within the address's `locality`, if any.

administrative_district_level_1.description:
A civil entity within the address's country. In the US, this
is the state. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

postal_code.description: The address's postal code. For a full list of field meanings by country, see [Working with Addresses](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/build-basics/working-with-addresses).

country.description: The address's country, in the two-letter format of ISO 3166. For example, `US` or `FR`.

phone_number.description: The phone number associated with the customer profile. A phone number can contain 9–16 digits, with an optional `+` prefix.

birthday.description:
The birthday associated with the customer profile, in RFC 3339 format. The year is optional. The timezone and time are not allowed.
For example, `0000-09-21T00:00:00-00:00` represents a birthday on September 21 and `1998-09-21T00:00:00-00:00` represents a birthday on September 21, 1998.

reference_id.description:
An optional second ID used to associate the customer profile with an
entity in another system.

note.description: A custom note associated with the customer profile.

email_unsubscribed.description: Indicates whether the customer has unsubscribed from marketing campaign emails. A value of `true` means that the customer chose to opt out of email marketing from the current Square seller or from all Square sellers. This value is read-only from the Customers API.

creation_source.description: The method used to create the customer profile.

group_ids.description: The IDs of customer groups the customer belongs to.

segment_ids.description: The IDs of segments the customer belongs to.

version.description: The Square-assigned version number of the customer profile. The version number is incremented each time an update is committed to the customer profile, except for changes to customer segment membership and cards on file.

tax_ids.description:
The tax ID associated with the customer profile. This field is present only for customers of sellers in EU countries or the United Kingdom. 
For more information, see [Customer tax IDs](https://developer.squareup.com/docs/customers-api/what-it-does#customer-tax-ids).

eu_vat.description:
The EU VAT number for this location. For example, `IE3426675K`.
If the EU VAT number is present, it is well-formed and has been
validated with VIES, the VAT Information Exchange System.

fr_siret.description:
The SIRET (Système d'Identification du Répertoire des Entreprises et de leurs Etablissements)
number is a 14 digit code issued by the French INSEE. For example, `39922799000021`.

fr_naf.description:
The French government uses the NAF (Nomenclature des Activités Françaises) to display and
track economic statistical data. This is also called the APE (Activite Principale de l’Entreprise) code.
For example, `6910Z`.

es_nif.description:
The NIF (Numero de Identificacion Fiscal) number is a 9 character tax identifier used in Spain.
If it is present, it has been validated. For example, `73628495A`.

description: Represents a Square customer profile in the Customer Directory of a Square seller.
